content: this shawl gets its name from the starlight lace stitch from barbara walkers a second treasury of knitting patterns and the traditional shetland lace patterns i used including the trellis diamond and small trees patterns it is triangular and is knit from the top down with increases on every right-side row worked at the edges and each side of the center stitch the two halves are mirror images of each other since starlight lace is not symmetrical i made it with a hand spun lace yarn but i think it would work well for most lace to light fingering weight yarns warning - the pattern has not been test knitted by anyone other than myself so there may be errors please let me know if you find any and i will post a corrected version thanks 05-26-2022 version 2 - added missing decreases to row 11 07-22-2022 version 3 - added missing yo to row 57 in right chart 1 08-11-2022 version 4 -added missing yo to row 57 in left chart 1 which i somehow managed to miss when i fixed in the the right chart 11-08-2022 version 5 - right chart 1 row 39 stitch 52 was changed to ssk and left chart 1 row 39 stitch 32 was changed to a k2tog 11-15-2022 version 6 - changed repeated row for a longer shawl from 209-213 to 209-231 11-26-2022 version 7 - added missing decreases to right chart 2 st 52 and left chart 2 st 12 06-28-2024 version 8 - chart 4 row 191 changed stitch 64 from a knit to an ssk 01-18-2025 version 9 - removed extra decrease from the beginning and end of row 113 right and left charts 2
